result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Charles F Rosien IV was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Rosien to 3 and 1 half years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.  This sentence is to commence consecutive to previously imposed sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: --Fine of $1500 + costs, fees assessments and surcharges, including DNA surcharge

--Maintain absolute sobriety

--No operation of a motor vehicle 

--No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs

--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores

--To undergo any type of assessment, treatment or counseling per Agent

--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

Arresting Agency: Watertown PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

supervisions.notes:
--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months

--6 demerit points assessed

--County alcohol/drug assessment ordered

--Victim impact panel attendance

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 10:06 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Charles F Rosien in court, in-custody from Oshkosh Correctional, with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds the Defendant  guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2

On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Rosien to 3 and 1 half years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.  This sentence is to commence consecutive to previously imposed sentence. 

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 0 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No operation of a motor vehicle 
--No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--To undergo any type of assessment, treatment or counseling per Agent
--Fine of $1500 + costs, fees assessments and surcharges, including DNA surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

Conditions NOT of extended supervision:
--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months
--County alcohol/drug assessment ordered
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device requirement/restrictions for: 36 months
--6 demerit points assessed

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Recess: 10:47 am
Defendant from Oshkosh Correctional for the 6/30/16 hearing
to Produce and Transport the Defendant from Oshkosh Correctional on June 30, 2016 for proceedings in Branch 4
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 30, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Charles F Rosien in court, in custody with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Mr.Rosien   waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
recess: 11:39am

NEXT:   (1) Plea and Sentencing on 6/30/16 at 10:00am(argued)
and Transport the Defendant from OshKosh Correctional on 5-13-2016 for proceedings in Branch 4
Preliminary hearing on May 13, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Stipulation for Continuance of the presently scheduled Preliminary Hearing on 4-22-2016
for Substitution of Attorneys. IT IS ORDERED Attorney Joseph F Fischer of Fischer Law Office shall be substituted as attorney for the Defendant, Charles F Rosien in this action
to Produce and Transport the Defendant from OshKosh Correctional on April 22, 2016 for proceedings in Branch 4
Proposed Stipulation and Order for Substitution of Attorneys
Preliminary hearing on April 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Reserve Judge Davis presiding for Branch IV:  
[MK] case called at 11:08am. 
Defendant Charles F Rosien appears via videoconferencing from Oshkosh Correctional Institution, in custody.  His counsel, Attorney Steven Luchsinger, appears in court.  Proposed Successor Defense counsel Attorney Joseph Fischer also appears in court.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears in court for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court verifies that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
On request of Mr. Rosien, and on the agreement of counsel, the Court allows Attorney Fischer to be substituted as Defense counsel. 
Attorney Fischer requests the scheduling of another status conference, indicating that a plea-offer was recently made by the State. 
After a discussion about the age of the case, the Court schedules the case, instead, for Preliminary Hearing. 
recess 11:15am. 

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 4/22/16 at 8:30am --the State is to prepare a writ, however if Attorney Fischer determines that there will be a waiver of Prelim, then Attorney Fischer is to alert the Court and the DA of this, so that arrangements can be made for Mr. Rosien to appear via videoconferencing

ADDRESS INFO for Charles F. Rosien
Current: PO Box 3310, c/o Oshkosh Correctional Institution, Oshkosh, WI 54903-3310 United States  (Effective: 01-19-2016)
Prior: PO Box 700, c/o Dodge Correctional Institution, Waupun, WI 53963-0700 United States

Case called at 8:42am [mo]
Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV

Defendant Charles F Rosien does NOT appear court.
Attorney Steven John Luchsinger appears in court. ADA  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Luchsinger indicates that a writ was failed to be executed for Mr. Rosien's appearance 
The Court reschedules this hearing to allow Mr. Rosien to appear
Counsel agree Mr. Rosien may appear by video
ADA Hall requests that shall circumstances change and Mr. Rosien must appear in person, Atty. Luchsinger is to notify the State.
recess: 8:46am

NEXT: Status Conference on 3/11/16 at 11:00am((to appear by video))
Copy of letter to the defendant from SPD advising additional information is needed to appoint counsel

Case called at 9:47 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Charles F Rosien appears via telephone, in-custody, with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer, who appears in court. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Mr. Rosien informs the Court that he does not object the motion filed by Atty Fischer, as he no longer has monies to pay 
Court reviews right to counsel with Mr. Rosien
Mr. Rosien informs the Court that he would like counsel in this matter
Court informs Mr. Rosien of the process to contact SPD in Jefferson County
Atty Fischer informs Mr. Rosien to contact his social worker about this pending case so SPD can be appointed
Court directs Atty Fischer to contact SPD and inform them of Mr. Rosien's next Court date, location and need for Counsel
Upon questioning of the Court, Mr. Rosien requests that January 15th date be changed to a Status rather than a Preliminary Hearing to be sure he has counsel.
Mr. Rosien indicates that he may be transferred from DCI prior to January 15th.
Recess: 9:53 am 

NEXT: (1) CHANGE 1/15/16 PRELIM TO STATUS
from Atty Fischer re: Def. is not allowed to make calls, request to call Def.
to withdraw, with request for Defendant to appear via telephone (with cover letter)
Proposed OTPRO for the 1/15/16 Preliminiary Hearing

Case called at 10:45 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Charles F Rosien appears via video, in-custody, with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer, who appears in court. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Atty Fischer: Requests matter be set for preliminary hearing in approximately 45 days, as there is some question if representation will continue. Have had PTC, but resolution has not yet been reached
DA Happ: No objection
Atty Fischer informs the Court that the preliminary hearing date is stacked with a trial date, but do believe trial will resolve, if not, will contact the court.
Recess: 10:48 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Preliminary Hearing 1/15/16 at 8:30 am- Send notices

Case called at 2:30 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Charles F Rosien in court. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Fischer informs the Court that Mr. Rosien was in-custody in Dodge County on Wednesday and will be moving into DCI shortly after a sentencing hearing, so is unable to appear today; requests that case be set for status conference - may also be able to accomplish a waiver of preliminary, but do still need to discuss with prosecutor as State was awaiting this sentence for recommendations in this case
DA Happ: No objection
Recess: 2:32 pm

NEXT: Schedule STC (Possible WOPH) 11/20/15 at 10:30 am - Send notices **VIA VIDEO - should be in DCI at this time**

Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 1:26-pm. [mo]
Defendant Charles F Rosien appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD appears for Bond Purposes only).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Atty. Svehlek indicates that Mr. Rosien is NOT eligible for PD representation.
Right to Counsel given

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies date of birth and address on Criminal Complaint are correct
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5,000  signature bond, with conditions:
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--take all medications a prescribed 
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--not to drive without a valid drivers license
--The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.

The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees. **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

recess 1:40 pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 9/9/2015 at 1:40pm  (2) Status Conference on 10/6/15 at 10:00am
